posts.name: Fedor Indutny
posts.cooked:
Hello everyone! The Signal team is releasing a new version of Signal Desktop, v7.61.0-beta.1. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta here.

Release notes:

  • This update improves audio quality and reliability during voice and video calls, and introduces better automatic configuration of connected microphones and speakers. Thanks to @padenot, @kinetiknz, and @Pehrsons at Mozilla for their help with this project.

Commit changes: Comparing v7.60.0-beta.1…v7.61.0-beta.1 · signalapp/Signal-Desktop · GitHub

New Version: 7.61.0-beta.1

32 new commits since 7.60.0-beta.1:

Show commits

  • v7.61.0-alpha.1 [1]

  • Hide deprecated unicode family emoji from picker [2]

  • Init Chat Folders Settings UI [3]

  • Use new compact representations in protobufs [4]

  • Backups: subscription info improvements [5]

  • Update mock-server to 13.0.1 [6]

  • Avoid foreign index constraint error when saving message attachments [7]

  • Update release notes [8]

  • Update strings [9]

  • Update DNS fallback [10]

  • Donations UI Receipt Generation [11]

  • Reorganize test cases [12]

  • Remote Config flag for PQ ratchet. [13]

  • Demote sender key error in Signal Protocol Store [14]

  • Initial workflow for donations [15]

  • Link previews: return the image content type after transcoding [16]

  • Improve saveAttachmentDownloadJob error handling [17]

  • Link previews for image URLs [18]

  • Update libsignal-client to 0.76.0 [19]

  • Limit linked device interaction with backup service [20]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.54.1 [21]

  • Backups: update integration tests [22]

  • Fix db error from concurrent processing of call link update sync [23]

  • Restrict message attachments shown in gallery & lightbox [24]

  • Dev tools grepping [25]

  • Disable fun error boundary toast in prod [26]

  • Simplify donation receipts [27]

  • Fix debuglogs window [28]

  • [signalapp/Signal-Desktop#7403] use fromSeconds when setting universalExpireTimer [29]

  • Release notes for 7.61 [30]

  • Update strings [31]

  • 7.61.0-beta.1 [32]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Desktop v7.60.0-beta.1…v7.61.0-beta.1

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

At least 67 languages changed since 7.60.0-beta.1:

For technical reasons, not all languages may be listed below. However, everything from “Updated language translations” and similar commits is listed, so the list is likely complete. You can view the full comparison to 7.60.0-beta.1 so far here.

Previous beta (archived too soon @indutny-signal): Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.60 release - #3 by Aku-Stable

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.60 release

posts.cooked:
I got an out-of-order message, is that still something that’s expected?

The messages are in the right order on my Android. But on desktop, it appears after, even though the timestamp is correct. Closing and reopening doesn’t fix it, so the history is consistent across android and desktop. I have another desktop instance for which I don’t have this problem.

2025-07-06-164801_2055x640_scrot2055×640 27.9 KB

See the last message on this screenshot, dated 2:52 PM, way earlier than the other messages there.

The timestamp of the message is
1751806342731

Debug log:
https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.61.0-beta.1/df4b0a37e299ceff5edb755b98b557e4731341c0a510dc75f6e26884cbb30846.gz

On the other instance where the problem did not appear:
https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.60.0/66681ddd915686d7905cdf02fe43da86d475d8df04b86e942a54c95d75ba10f6.gz

posts.name: scott-signal
posts.cooked:
For the instance where the problem happened, it looks like the message came in off the websocket in the right order:

INFO  2025-07-06T14:38:34.116Z [MessageReceiver] queueing envelope > [REDACTED]8eb 1751806267395 (0197e02ca9d4713f883c9ae7d64499f5)
INFO  2025-07-06T14:38:34.116Z [MessageReceiver] queueing envelope [REDACTED]8eb.1 > [REDACTED]8eb 1751806301085 (0197e02ca9d4713f883c9c5f4f52d3e6)
INFO  2025-07-06T14:38:34.116Z [MessageReceiver] queueing envelope [REDACTED]8eb.1 > [REDACTED]8eb 1751806342731 (0197e02ca9d4713f883ca2a4e3cecff3)
INFO  2025-07-06T14:38:34.116Z [MessageReceiver] queueing envelope > [REDACTED]8eb 1751806344382 (0197e02ca9d4713f883ca7307749e97e)
INFO  2025-07-06T14:38:34.116Z [MessageReceiver] queueing envelope > [REDACTED]8eb 1751806487295 (0197e02ca9d4713f883caad1e1b6f5b4)

And for the desktop that doesn’t have the out-of-order problem, it’ s the same set of five messages:

INFO  2025-07-06T14:38:34.659Z queueing envelope > [REDACTED]8eb 1751806267395 (0197e02cab18723fb2b0f33f06c81109)
INFO  2025-07-06T14:38:34.659Z queueing envelope [REDACTED]8eb.1 > [REDACTED]8eb 1751806301085 (0197e02cab18723fb2b0f7d5bcfa9fa9)
INFO  2025-07-06T14:38:34.659Z queueing envelope [REDACTED]8eb.1 > [REDACTED]8eb 1751806342731 (0197e02cab18723fb2b0fb47e892e1e7)
INFO  2025-07-06T14:38:34.659Z queueing envelope > [REDACTED]8eb 1751806344382 (0197e02cab18723fb2b0fef27973aa10)
INFO  2025-07-06T14:38:34.659Z queueing envelope > [REDACTED]8eb 1751806487295 (0197e02cab18723fb2b10281d61d89da)

Can you provide a screenshot of the ‘correct’ desktop as well as the timestamps of the messages right around the out-of-order messages? (like, the two messages that should surround the message, and the ones that are actually surrounding it?)

That will help us better understand the situation. Thanks!

posts.name: scott-signal
posts.cooked: Hey there - thanks for the report. In your log, I can’t seem to find the database error you’re talking about. Can you provide a screenshot of it?
Signal showed me the message „database error“ when i clicked on the button „submit debug log“

posts.name: scott-signal
posts.cooked: We found the issue. Sorry you ran into it! We’ll fix it soon
